title: Research & use existing DOM types module instead of ElementSpec
description: ElementSpec may be redundant if standard DOM types exist. Research: 1) Check if @types/dom or similar has HTMLElement types we can use. 2) Evaluate if existing types are better than custom ElementSpec. 3) If yes, migrate ElementSpec to use standard types. Benefits: tighter contracts, better ecosystem compatibility.
notes:
Research complete. Conclusion: Keep ElementSpec as-is.

Investigated:
- TypeScript lib.dom.d.ts (20k+ lines of DOM definitions)
- JSR packages (@lilian1315/elements-writable-properties-types, @std/html)
- deno-dom (third-party DOM implementation)

Key Finding: ElementSpec and DOM types serve fundamentally different purposes:
- ElementSpec: Zod validation schema for serializable HTML specs (data format)
- HTMLElement: TypeScript interfaces for runtime browser APIs (behavior)

ElementSpec must remain because:
1. Security validation (blocks script/iframe, event handlers)
2. Serialization (pure data, no methods)
3. Zod schema validation with runtime type checking
4. Purpose-built for specification/validation layer

Standard DOM types are NOT a replacement - they're complementary but serve different use cases.
close_reason: Research complete. ElementSpec serves a different purpose than DOM types (validation/serialization vs runtime API). Should keep as-is.
